La Grosse Cloche - a bell tower in Bordeaux, France, is the emblem of the city. It was built in 1775 and is located in the Place de la Victoire, in Bordeaux's city centre. The belfry is all that remains of the old Town Hall that was demolished in 1883. The bell tower is classified as a historical monument of France since 1943.

![](./images/Bordeaux/bordeaux3.png)

Porte Caihau - a gate in the old city walls of Bordeaux, France. It was built in 1494 and is classified as a historical monument of France since 1883. The King Charles VIII of France ordered the construction of the gate in 1494. It was the main gate to the city until 1753. The gate was named after the Cailhau family, who were the owners of the land on which the gate was built. The gate was built in the Gothic style. It is 35 metres high and 20 metres wide. The gate is decorated with sculptures of the kings of France and the city of Bordeaux. The gate was restored in 1883.
